data.title: Solved: NTP Stratum issue
data.meta_description: Solved: Hi I have configure a Router 2921 to act as NTP server for my network devices. It sinchronize with a Windows sever 2016 NTP but is not workng NODO1#sh ntp associations address ref clock st when poll reach delay offset disp ~IPSERVER .LOCL. 1
data.text:
Hi

I have configure a Router 2921 to act as NTP server for my network devices. It sinchronize with a Windows sever 2016 NTP

but is not workng

NODO1#sh ntp associations

address ref clock st when poll reach delay offset disp

~IPSERVER .LOCL. 1 50 64 377 2.300 -953909 1.700

* sys.peer, # selected, + candidate, - outlyer, x falseticker, ~ configured

NODO1#sh ntp associations de

IPSERVER configured, insane, invalid, stratum 1

ref ID .LOCL., time E44005D6.AAFB422B (14:30:46.667 VEN Fri May 7 2021)

our mode client, peer mode server, our poll intvl 64, peer poll intvl 64

root delay 0.00 msec, root disp 10031.81, reach 377, sync dist 10044.69

delay 2.31 msec, offset -9539104.7596 msec, dispersion 4.59

precision 2**23, version 4

org time E4401093.F2EB0673 (15:16:35.948 VEN Fri May 7 2021)

rec time E44035D7.0C2A7C6B (17:55:35.047 VEN Fri May 7 2021)

xmt time E44035D7.0B557D74 (17:55:35.044 VEN Fri May 7 2021)

filtdelay = 3.24 3.36 2.50 4.03 197.30 2.72 203.49 2.31

filtoffset = -953909 -953909 -953909 -953909 -953909 -953910 -953910 -953910

filterror = 0.00 0.99 1.93 2.91 3.85 4.83 5.80 6.76

minpoll = 6, maxpoll = 10

the problem I see is that windows server says he is Stratum 1

any advice will be appreciate

Solved! Go to Solution.

@rommelotero wrote:

I have configure a Router 2921 to act as NTP server for my network devices. It sinchronize with a Windows sever 2016 NTP

Not going to work + never going to work.

Cisco appliances follow the "standard" NTP while MS have their own set of "standards" that is incompatible with the recognized NTP standard.

MS can synchronize to a Cisco appliance but never the other way around.

View solution in original post
